thread.title: Finalists named for top Lake rookie teacher, noninstructional worker
thread.title_full: Finalists named for top Lake rookie teacher, noninstructional worker

author: Jerry Fallstrom
title: Finalists named for top Lake rookie teacher, noninstructional worker
text:
Finalists named for top Lake rookie teacher, noninstructional worker Ella Gibson Lake County school district Ella Gibson, an AVID (Advancement via Individual Determination) teacher at Windy Hill Middle School in Clermont, is a finalist for Lake County Rookie Teacher of the Year. Ella Gibson, an AVID (Advancement via Individual Determination) teacher at Windy Hill Middle School in Clermont, is a finalist for Lake County Rookie Teacher of the Year. (Lake County school district) Jerry Fallstrom school district’s awards for top rookie teacher and noninstructional worker.
Rookie Teacher of the Year finalists are Maverick Baer, an emotional and behavioral disability teacher at of Carver Middle School in Leesburg; Ella Gibson, an AVID (Advancement via Individual Determination) teacher at Windy Hill Middle School in Clermont; and Evelyn J. Guzman, a fourth-grade teacher at Triangle Elementary School in Mount Dora. 
To be eligible for the “rookie” award, teachers must have been in the classroom for no more than three full years. 
The School-Related Employee of the Year award is for rank-and-file workers in positions such as secretaries, media specialists and bus drivers. Finalists are Micheka Thomas, a data-entry operator at Carver Middle School; Caroline Thompson, a school nurse at Minneola Charter Elementary School; and Maria Torres, a family-engagement specialist with of the district’s Title I Department. 
The six finalists were notified Tuesday by a caravan of officials led by Superintendent Susan Moxley. 
The rookie award will be announced at an award ceremony March 22. The noninstructional award will be announced April 19. 
jfallstrom@orlandosentinel.com or 352-742-5916
